Author: BlackMarket#6984
Content:
"Actually, you’re explaining the process of installing llvm-gcc which is actually not the actual gcc. Its a modified version made by Apple to compile C/Obj-C programs.

Although this is fine for most purposes, some other tools (I think its Ruby, not sure) require the original gcc package. Not the llvm one."

Author: BlackMarket#6984

Author: Spaid#3606
Content:
I guess I need some additional help... have tried the instructions in the pinned message multiple times, including leaving the wallet overnight afterwards to see if it would sync with the mainchain at some point, but no luck.  I, like others, am using the latest Windows Ocean wallet v2.0.15-rc2 64bit, have 16 connections, and am stuck at block 1444268, so my console looks like this:

> getblockhash 1444268
< 000000010bffc32b1452a6cd5fdb6715845c505e94b93ae6325b9684c503a80b
> invalidateblock 000000010bffc32b1452a6cd5fdb6715845c505e94b93ae6325b9684c503a80b
< null
> reconsiderblock 035ee329fe10944f1b0bf659a8b8d2424322b98532deba0fe225f26eb350fdb2
< null

The wallet then sits in "Synchronizing with network..." until I shut it down.  It has been in that state for 4 hours now.

for the reconsiderblock command I also tried using the value 000000010bffc32b1452a6cd5fdb6715845c505e94b93ae6325b9684c503a80b but it did not work.  The pinned message does not specify if the block that was invalidated is what is supposed to be reconsidered, so I tried both.  There are no further instructions on the pinned message, but my wallet has yet to get past this block when I wait all night or restart.  I also tried a restart with a 'maxreorder = 300' but did not get any results.  What am I missing?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: are you sure you are running this version specifically? https://github.com/DeckerSU/KomodoOcean/releases/tag/v2.0.15-rc2-g28-4

Author: SHossain#0007
Content:
`v2.0.15-rc2-g28-4`
`4` is the number at the end to look for

Author: Spaid#3606
Content: I can give it a try reinstalling... the help screen in the wallet doesn't have anythng after g28

Author: Spaid#3606
Content: or downloading the one out there and install

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: please use only the version i posted above and delete any existing version from your computer

Author: SHossain#0007
Content:
`'maxreorder = 300'`

this should be `-maxreorg=300`. if you used what you posted, would not work as that is wrong parameter

Author: msg768 ⚡#4220
Content: Hey guys. How do I submit for a new coin to be listed?

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: @msg768 ⚡ listed in?

Author: msg768 ⚡#4220
Content: Atomic swap. Dex.

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
@msg768 ⚡ first it needs to be tested to work with the Marketmaker software: https://developers.komodoplatform.com/basic-docs/atomicdex/atomicdex-tutorials/atomicdex-walkthrough.html
then added here: https://github.com/jl777/coins

after that there is some listing fee to be added to the AtomicDEX app, 

but if it is added to the coins repo I posted above, any GUI will be able to list it, so that is the first step

may I know the coin name?

Author: msg768 ⚡#4220
Content: Ok so do I test it? SwiftCash [SWIFT]

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
@msg768 ⚡ yes, test it and add sth like
```
{
  "coin": "LTC",
  "name": "litecoin",
  "fname": "Litecoin",
  "rpcport": 9332,
  "pubtype": 48,
  "p2shtype": 5,
  "wiftype": 176,
  "txfee": 100000,
  "mm2": 1
}
```
to the coins file: https://github.com/jl777/coins/blob/master/coins
it will be placed in the root directory of the repo https://github.com/KomodoPlatform/atomicDEX-API after it is downloaded
Install instructions here: https://developers.komodoplatform.com/basic-docs/atomicdex/atomicdex-setup/get-started-atomicdex.html

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: @msg768 ⚡ I would advise you to first get in contact with @cipi to make sure  SwiftCash has the necessary features for integration

Author: msg768 ⚡#4220
Content: We recently forked and added BIP65 which is all that is needed I believe if I am not wrong. Maybe @cipi can correct me if I'm wrong.

Author: msg768 ⚡#4220
Content: But we're not SHA256. We're Keccak :/

Author: msg768 ⚡#4220
Content: Not sure what the implications of that could be. Since even our pub and private keys are based on Keccak and not SHA256.

Author: cipi#4502
Content:
Hi. The code https://github.com/swiftcashproject/swiftcash looks good, afaict
If  Keccak is only used as a mining alg, it doesn't matter, we have integrated many different coins with different minig algos. If Keccak is also used for transaction signing, we will run into this issue: https://github.com/KomodoPlatform/atomicDEX-API/issues/462 (SMART is also using Keccak)
If so, we will need to wait till this is fixed/added to mm2, which will happen for sure.
